subject: JUnit with MS JView?
msgSnippet: I m trying to run JUnit with Microsoft s jview (or wjview), and cannot get it working. I m including the 1.1.8 jre rt.jar in the /cp passed to jview,

I'm trying to run JUnit with Microsoft's jview (or wjview), and cannot 
get it working.

I'm including the 1.1.8 jre rt.jar in the /cp passed to jview, 
with/without the Microsoft lib .zips.

If I try:

    set classpath=.;..\cps;%CLASSPATH%;C:\Program
    Files\Java\jre1.1.8_010\lib\rt.jar;

    jview /cp "%CLASSPATH%" junit.swingui.TestRunner

I get:

    ERROR: Unable to locate system class: java/lang/String

If I put in 05B1NVDJ.ZIP (MS's .zip with java/lang/String in it...):

    set
    classpath=.;..\cps;%CLASSPATH%;c:\windows\java\packages\05B1NVDJ.ZIP;C:\Program
    Files\Java\jre1.1.8_010\lib\rt.jar;

    jview /cp "%CLASSPATH%" junit.swingui.TestRunner

I get:

    ERROR: java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: javax/swing/JTextField


Maybe it's just not meant to be ... anyone ever get this to work?

-- 
Chris
